name: San Fernando
shortDescription: A historic city in the San Fernando Valley with small-town charm, parks, and strong community ties.
fullDescription: San Fernando is an independent city in the northwestern Los Angeles area, offering a welcoming small-town feel within the larger San Fernando Valley. The city features historic architecture, local shops, and community events, alongside convenient access to regional employment centers and freeways. Parks, libraries, and cultural institutions make it attractive for families and long-time residents alike.
heroImageAlt: Tree-lined street with low-rise buildings in a sunny urban area

highlights.title: Historic Downtown San Fernando
highlights.description: Charming main street with local shops, cafes, and community events.

highlights.description: Neighborhood parks with sports facilities, playgrounds, and green spaces.

highlights.title: Cultural Heritage
highlights.description: Local museums and cultural programs celebrating the city's rich history.

highlights.title: Central Valley Access
highlights.description: Quick connections to I-5, I-210, and key San Fernando Valley destinations.

faqs.question: What is San Fernando known for?
faqs.answer: San Fernando is known for its historic downtown, community events, and small-town atmosphere within the Valley.

faqs.question: How is the real estate market in San Fernando?
faqs.answer: The market features primarily single-family homes and small multifamily properties with competitive Valley pricing.

faqs.question: What can you do in San Fernando?
faqs.answer: Explore historic downtown, visit local parks, and enjoy community programs and cultural sites.

faqs.question: How is commuting from San Fernando?
faqs.answer: Access to I-5 and I-210 connects residents to jobs across the San Fernando Valley and greater LA region.
